channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NY

item.title: Report E-2023100190
item.description:
Report E-2023100190

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-08
  • City: MONTGOMERY
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the metal 55 gallon drum of acetone (un1090) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 10 ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report I-2023090134
item.description:
Report I-2023090134

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-11T15:10:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-03
  • City: Albany
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HERITAGE TRANSPORT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At approximately 10:00 Sunday 09/03/23, a Heritage Transport employee contacted the facility Manager of the Heritage Albany 10-day to let him know there was a Leaking container on a staged trailer. The facility manager unloaded the trailer and identified the container, an FIBC. Approximately lgal of liquid leaked from the FIBC. The. leak was absorbed using absorbent pads and granular absorbent. The FIBC was 6verpacked into a new FIBC. The absorbent material was packaged for transport/ disposal.
